page.title: 06Living in Leighfield
page.content: Park Wood Farm (803032) is an isolated farmhouse which forms part of Launde Estate. Until 1979 there were no amenities but since then improvements have included a septic tank, the building of a road to the house, the pumping and piping of water to the house from a spring 40 yds away and the installation of electricity brought in from Copt Hill Farm. The farm is half a mile from the Launde to Loddington road. The village of Belton is about two miles away by footpath and has reasonable amenities. The dustman doesn't call but the milkman would if wanted. Mail is left in a box halfway between the farm and the road. Children go to Loddington to catch a bus to Tugby School and a petrol allowance is paid for this. The Launde _ Loddington boundary passes through the house.
